risk.controller

Class RiskStartGameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • risk.controller.RiskStartGameController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class RiskStartGameController
extends java.awt.Frame
    This class is the main controller of the application and contains the logic for the map editor.
    Author:
    Team8
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getAdjacentCountryInfo

        public java.lang.String getAdjacentCountryInfo(java.lang.String adjacentTerritory,
                                               java.lang.String currentCountry,
                                               java.lang.String currentContinent)
                                        throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                               org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                               java.io.IOException
        This method will find the coordinates and continent of the adjacent countries supplied by the user and append it to JTextArea.
        Parameters:
        adjacentTerritory - the adjacent territory
        currentCountry - the current country
        currentContinent - the current continent
        Returns:
        String with coordinates and continent for adjacent country - adjacentTerritory.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - the parser configuration exception
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - the SAX exception
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

      • mapEditTextInsertCoordinates

        public java.lang.String mapEditTextInsertCoordinates(java.lang.String mapInputLineText)
        To find the territory which the user supplied in his/her input text. To find the coordinates of the supplied territory from the baseMap - EarthMap. Append the found coordinates to the input text and insert them in the JTextArea in Choose Map Panel.
        Parameters:
        mapInputLineText - the map input line text
        Returns:
        String, the complete line text with the coordinates inserted after the territory.

        Parameters:

      • fetchCoordinates

        public java.lang.String fetchCoordinates(java.lang.String territory)
        Fetch the coordinates of the territories given to this method. Call the recursive search function to perform the search.
        Parameters:
        territory - the territory
        Returns:
        = String, the coordinates of the territory supplied in string - e.g - ,XX,YY, - format.

      • updateIndexToNextTerritory

        public int updateIndexToNextTerritory(java.lang.String baseMapString,
                                      java.lang.String territory,
                                      int index)
        The recursive search take a smaller text every iteration till the correct instance of territory is found. This method sends the begin index for the new cut-shorted string for the next recursive search.
        Parameters:
        baseMapString - the base map string
        territory - the territory
        index - the index
        Returns:
        begin index, for the upcoming recursive search.

      • isCoordinatesNextToIt

        public boolean isCoordinatesNextToIt(java.lang.String baseMapString,
                                     int index,
                                     java.lang.String territory)
        Checks whether the instance of territory found in the base map has coordinates next to it or not.
        Parameters:
        baseMapString - base earth map in string format.
        index - index of the first occurrence 'territory' in the base map
        territory - the territory supplied by the user.
        Returns:
        Boolean, true if this is the instance of territory with coordinates next to it else False.

      • validateMapLineInputText

        public java.lang.Boolean validateMapLineInputText(java.lang.String mapInputLineText)
                                           throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                                                  org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                                  java.io.IOException
        To check of the user has inserted the text in the proper format. Check if corresponding territories and continents exist.
        Parameters:
        mapInputLineText - the input text from the user in the needed format specifying the adjacent countries.
        Returns:
        Boolean, returns true if input text is valid, else false.
        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - the parser configuration exception
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - the SAX exception
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
